title: Sinusoidal Function Modeling - Windmill - Part C

content.question: Part C Refer to the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> in part (A). The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>t</mn> </math>-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>G</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>J</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> ? <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and increasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and decreasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and increasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and decreasing. (ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is changing on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: Part C Refer to the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> in part (A). The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>t</mn> </math>-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>G</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>J</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> ? <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and increasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and decreasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and increasing. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and decreasing. (ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is changing on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
